medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Approximately 3 weeks before evaluation, the patient developed mild pruritus of the palms and soles. She reported feeling 'crummy' during the previous week and noticed decreased fetal activity that day, with only four movements in 1 hour despite hydration. On admission, she reported nausea, decreased appetite, frequent urination, subjective fevers, chills, and resolved contractions over the previous 2 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Iron-deficiency anemia, hyperemesis, sickle cell trait, gastroesophageal reflux disease, exercise-induced asthma, dysmenorrhea, stress fracture of left tibia, Clostridium difficile infection after clindamycin use, and pancreatitis.
medical_history.family_history: Father had deep venous thromboses; husband does not carry the sickle-cell trait.
medical_history.social_history: Does not smoke tobacco, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs. Avoided eating lunch meat or soft cheeses during pregnancy, consumed well-boiled hot dogs and frequently ate commercial-brand hummus.
